Use Rob Hyndman's forecast package to estimate drift in ARIMA models

Source: R/Arima.R
Arima_nation.Rd

Use Rob Hyndman's forecast package to estimate drift in ARIMA models

Arima_nation(
  ejhu,
  alp3 = "USA",
  MAorder = 2,
  Difforder = 1,
  basedate = "2020-02-15",
  lookback_days = 29,
  ARorder = 0,
  max_date = NULL
)

Arguments

ejhu

a tibble as returned by enriched_jhu_data()
alp3

character(1) alpha3Code value for country
MAorder

numeric(1) order of moving average component
Difforder

numeric(1) differencing order d of ARIMA(p,d,q)
basedate

character(1) used by lubridate::as_date to filter away all earlier records
lookback_days

numeric(1) only uses this many days from most recent in ejhu
ARorder

order of autoregressive component
max_date

a date from which to start lookback ... defaults to NULL in which case the latest available date is used

Value

instance of S3 class Arima_sars2pack

Examples

ej = enriched_jhu_data()
lkus = Arima_nation(ej)
lkus
#> Arima_sars2pack instance for USA 
#>   computed Sun Aug 16 03:44:17 2020 
#>   last date used was:  2020-08-14 
#>   call was: Arima_nation(ejhu = ej)
#>   Model estimates: 
#> Series: tsfull 
#> ARIMA(0,1,2) with drift 
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#>           ma1      ma2      drift
#>       -0.6036  -0.3963  -577.4101
#> s.e.   0.1767   0.1471   177.7372
#> 
#> sigma^2 estimated as 38888648:  log likelihood=-284.25
#> AIC=576.51   AICc=578.25   BIC=581.84
#> 
#> Training set error measures:
#>                     ME     RMSE      MAE       MPE     MAPE      MASE      ACF1
#> Training set -138.6753 5790.052 4780.051 -1.216969 8.312411 0.8605505 0.1061812
plot(lkus)
